Current steam release of this game is broken. Software rendering and 3D sound was removed, and the OpenGL renderer you have to use now isn't feature complete. You're better off finding a proper release somewhere else. Don't buy this if you want to play Half-Life. Right now, the source port is in MUCH better state despite being plagued with issues.

Oyun dünyasının en büyük öncülerinden biri olan Valve'den çağ değiştiren bir efsane. Çoğumuz zamanında bu oyunu bir şekilde tecrübe ettik, gerek kendimiz oynayarak, gerek izleyerek, gerekse hakkında bir şeyler duyarak. Bu oyunu düzgünce oynama ve bitirme fırsatına yeni sahip oldum ve şunu söylemeliyim ki şuan 22 yaşında olan bu oyun günümüzde bile hala oynanabilir durumda. Grafikleri göze batmıyor, oynanışı kesinlikle çok keyifli, serinin hikayesine zaten edilecek laf yok, evreni ve karakterleri efsane. Eminim ki aradan 100 yıl zaman geçse de bu oyun hala oynanabilir olacak. Bana göre Half-Life serisi her oyuncu tarafından mutlaka tecrübe edilmeli, eğer hala oynamadıysanız mutlaka oynayın.

Wow. As an individual who never experienced the Half-Life franchise in the younger age, I must say I am impressed of what was created back then. The game is extremely long, took me roughly 12-14 hours to fully finish the game at the hardest difficulty. I never used guides so finding everything myself might have increased the time it took a bit. Graphics are of course not the best, but the game was made a long while ago, so no hard thoughts on that. As far as the story and the interactive gameplay was, I am also impressed over how many details the game had. The military troops acted to my surprise very tactical. They threw grenades accordingly (seemed to always hit no matter what lol, quite annoying tbf) to where i stood and they would use commands to let the other troops they had heard/seen something. The story was very interesting, and I loved how suspicious Gman appeared in this game.

To summarize, I really regret not playing Half-Life as a kid. Despite this probably giving me nightmares back then, it would generate lots of nice memories. Well, you can't always experience everything when you want to, at least i played it now and it was extremely fun.

I'll recommend this game, because I'll respect it for the "classic" it is, but if this is your first time into this, all I'm going to say is it did NOT age well. When a game gives you guns, clunky controls, and uninteresting enemies, it just turns into a platforming mess. Legitimately, about 90% of the deaths I've experienced have just been from bad game mechanics. Best of luck to all you newcomers....5/10

Philosophically cutscenes really shouldn't be in video games. Games as an artform have a unique storytelling opportunity that allows narrative to be told entirely through gameplay. A perfect game explains everything about the plot by just throwing you into it. For this, "Half-Life" is a perfect game.

Boomer game, but fun

To be quite honest, I dont have a previous connection to this game. I didnt play this back when it released, however, I love it nevertheless. The movement is athletic, the weapons and enemy variety is satisfying. The voice acting is corny at times, but in all honesty I didn't mind, if anything it made the game all the more charming. The puzzles are also pretty good, different from what im used to, but good. All in all, it's a great game, and if you haven't played it i'd recommend you do!

Although the game has some good moments, what uniqueness it may have had when it came out ( I wasn't alive then, so I wouldn't know ) is lost due to what was considered new and exciting in the 90s is just the status quo in FPSs now. 

For all the praise the story recieves, it is very simplistic and generic. Their attempts to create characters are completely lost by the fact that there are only 5 unique character models and voice actors, resulting in characters looking and sounding the exact same. It also doesn't help that many of them have no unique lines of dialogue and they all act the same. The only character worth mentioning is the G-man, who you just see kind of walking around Black Mesa until the ending. All the characters who make it half life 2 just explain their origins, so as long as you know the basic story of this game it is completely unnecessary to play to understand half life 2, a far better game.

The weapons, with some exceptions like the laser gun or revolver, are not memorable at all. There is also an obnoxiously large amount of very obvious aim assist for some weapons, like the pistol. It negates any skill or practice the player has if the gun aims itself. The graphics are atrocious, and some parts are extremely punishing and frustrating, like the tentacle hydra thing or the helicopter. In both those parts, you spend two seconds outside of cover and lose the majority of your health.

The game reaches it's highpoints when the aliens begin an organised invasion, and you take part in these big battles between you, the military, and the alien soldiers. When that part arrives, the game's pacing picks up and there are many thrills to be had. There are some unique designs for levels and the gimmicks are actually alright, and the games full arsenal of weapons are available. Still, this is only about 25% of the game, and Xen is another 25%, so the majority if the game is just monotonous.

Overall, the game hasn't aged well. The combat ranges from boring to sort of good, the levels mostly all feel the same, the combat is just alright, and the story is barely present. I give Half life 1 a 2/5. Half life 2 is far better, go play that instead.

Un clasicazo allá donde los haya, corto pero muy divertido, y con una amplia variedad de innovaciones para la época, nada más ponerte en la piel de Gordon te sientes enganchado a su primera entrega de esta divertidísima saga. Merece muchísimo la pena probar este título antes de jugar su todavía más divertida y mejorada secuela (Half-Life 2) y los dos episodios que esta contiene. 100% recomendado.
